title: Burdett O'Connor Province
text:
Burdett O'Connor is a <a href="Provinces%20of%20Bolivia">province</a> in the northern part of <a href="Tarija%20Department">Tarija Department</a> in <a href="Bolivia">Bolivia</a>.
The province is also known as Burdett O'Connor and is named after <a href="Francisco%20Burdett%20O%27Connor">Francisco Burdett O'Connor</a>, a chronicler of the South American War of Independence and the making of <a href="Tarija%2C%20Bolivia">Tarija</a>.
Location.
Burdett O'Connor province is one of six provinces in the Tarija Department. It is located between 20° 53' and 21° 58' <a href="Latitude">south</a> and between 63° 36' and 64° 26' <a href="Longitude">west</a>.
The province borders <a href="Chuquisaca%20Department">Chuquisaca Department</a> in the north, <a href="Eustaquio%20M%C3%A9ndez%20Province">Eustaquio Méndez Province</a> in the north-west, <a href="Cercado%20Province%20%28Tarija%29">Cercado Province</a> in the west, <a href="Aniceto%20Arce%20Province">Aniceto Arce Province</a> in the south-west, and <a href="Gran%20Chaco%20Province">Gran Chaco Province</a> in the south and east. 
The province extends over from north to south, and from east to west.
Population.
The main language of the province is <a href="Spanish%20Language">Spanish</a>, spoken by 98.4%, while 10.3% of the population speak <a href="Guarani%20language">Guaraní</a>, also 1.8 speak <a href="Quechua%20language">Quechua</a>, and 0.3% <a href="Aymara%20language">Aymara</a> (by western immigrants). 
The population increased from 17,763 inhabitants (1992 <a href="census">census</a>) to 19,339 (2001 census), an increase of 8.9%. - 47.5% of the population are younger than 15 years old. 
 89.5% of the population have no access to <a href="Electricity%20generation">electricity</a>, 84.5% have no <a href="Tap%20water">sanitary facilities</a>. 
 51.6% of the population are employed in <a href="Primary%20sector%20of%20industry">agriculture</a>, 14.6% in <a href="mining">mining</a>, 7.0% in <a href="Secondary%20sector%20of%20industry">industry</a>, 26.8% in <a href="Tertiary%20sector%20of%20industry">general services</a> (2001).
 89.9% of the population are <a href="Roman%20Catholicism%20in%20Bolivia">Catholics</a>, 4.0% are <a href="Iglesia%20Anglicana%20del%20Cono%20Sur%20de%20las%20Americas">Protestants</a> (1992).
Division.
In contrast to the neighbouring provinces, the province comprises only one <a href="municipio">municipio</a> which is Entre Ríos.
It is identical to the Burdett O'Connor Province.
